result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond W. Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Amended 11/30/15 to include attorney fees due directly to the Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Count 2  -  1 year
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Within 5 days contact Family Crisis Center to schedule an intake session for Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.  If deemed appropriate for program to successfully complete and pay for program
Pay Victim Witness surcharge of $92.00 to Clerk of Courts
Execute any and all written releases
Provide DA's office with monthly written reports certifying compliance
Provide DA's office with all necessary written proof of full compliance with agreement
If complies - amend to county ordinance for Disorderly Conduct and request $263.50 plus $92.00
